title: league ban system hehe ecks dee
body: the riot ban system is fucking autistic. I got 14 days suspension and i never had chat bans on the account. I had 2 afk on my team and was doing good. They reconnected and said they had so high ping they cant connect and i told them that doesnt matter you are reported since after they connected they didint play they just cried about surrendering. So how are they the fucking victim?!?! I rather have a toxic guy that plays good than 2 afkers. I even stopped reporting people since i got multiple messages about how someone i reported got banned. It is fucking autistic that in game taunting is bannable i see it more as a tactic, tilt the enemy player so they lose even more. The mute option exists so why dont they just remove the bans.

replies.body:
>the riot ban system is fucking autistic.

I literally stopped reading right there, I have no idea what the rest of your post says, but that statement tells me that it is more than likely not worth reading and would be a waste of valuable seconds to bother.
but explain how im toxic saying report syndra and kayn for afk when they litterly are afk?

It's simple.  

When you tell others to report someone that is a form of harassment.  There is no reason to call for reports, because one report has the same weight as nine reports, therefore you are the only one that needs to report someone for an infraction.  If your report is determined to be a legitimate report by the system then those that are reported will have appropriate action taken against them---in the case of AFK they may receive a low priority queue, in the case of toxicity then it depends on the nature of how toxic they were... they may receive no immediate punishment but could be flagged for possible future sanctions---or they could receive chat restrictions or bans depending upon where they stand currently.  

So, calling for reports serves no purpose other than to further intimidate or harass players.  If you believe someone is doing something that is reportable than you are the only one that needs to report them, period.
I stopped reading at the title but clicked on it for the comments.
Seems like a giant waste of time.
Are you insinuating that I'm being homicidal with my time? Because you're absolutely correct.
No, I'm being sarcastic because humans are annoying me by not living up to their potential.

There's no point in reaching a potential without appreciating it by being more laid back about life. Working myself all the time would result in a great amount of wealth when I'm close to death but death is the end of perception so all that money would be wasted. It's best to enjoy what we perceive while we still can, even if we won't remember any of it after we die.
Fuck work. 143,080 hours is too long doing shit you don't want to do.

We want neither.
So, both get punished until they eitehr stop or receive a perma.
There is no need to choose between the two.

There is no comparison as to how they get punished. "Toxic" players will get an automated permaban, leavers/AFKers will never get more a 20 minute low priority que for 5 games. Its silly because you can simply mute "toxic" players, but if you have people who AFK/leave you're going to lose and theres nothing you can do about it.

> [{quoted}](name=The Big Piece,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=A5UN8O8e,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2017-07-14T19:11:12.359+0000)

> There is no comparison as to how they get punished. "Toxic" players will get an automated permaban, 

Only if he is eitehr racist/other hatespeech or ignores 35 games of chat restrictions and a 14-day ban.
Its is really, really hard to get a perma for flaming, you really have to be a total jerk.

> leavers/AFKers will never get more a 20 minute low priority que for 5 games. 

This statement is wrong, there are permabans for people that leave to often.
Just as it is for flamers. The difference is, that people dont start the game to leave...

> Its silly because you can simply mute "toxic" players,

and then the damage is already done.
The only thing we ask, is, that people dont flame others on a regular basis.
That is really not to much to ask, anyone who has a problemto comply is just a complete social wreck.
People want to enjoy the game, not get flamed by some jerk.

>  but if you have people who AFK/leave you're going to lose and theres nothing you can do about it.

Flamers loose you the game just as well.
They are afk while writing the essays, and they demotivate the team.
It is direct sabotage as well.
And there's nothing you can do about the flamer being afk and tilting the rest of your team aswell.

There is no 35 game chat restriction, it goes from 10 to 25, and then a two week ban into a perma. And no, it is not difficult at all to be perma'd, especially if you've already gone up to a two week ban. From that point on, any of what Riot considers to be "toxicity", no matter how minor, will lead to a perma.

There are no automated permabans for leaving games. Leaverbuster does not ban people and has a maximum punishment of 5 low priority que games.


And no, someone "flaming" will not lose you a game. Which do you believe is losing you the game, the 0/20 botlane or the person who called them "bad"?
